block.p: Dr. Alexandra Fell Freeman, a daughter of Lucile and Harry L. Freeman of Chevy Chase, Md., was married yesterday to Douglas Hugh Mackay Pyle, the son of Elizabeth Pyle Whitney of Weston, Mass., and the late Dr. Hugh Mackay Pyle. The Rev. Dr. Theodore Rosche, a Presbyterian minister, performed the ceremony at the Strong Mansion, a historic house in Dickerson, Md.

The couple graduated from Carleton College, the bride magna cum laude. They work in Chicago, where the bride is a fellow in pediatric infectious diseases at Children's Memorial Hospital and the bridegroom is the assistant to the president of the Chicago Transit Authority.

Dr. Alexandra Fell Freeman, a daughter of Lucile and Harry L. Freeman of Chevy Chase, Md., was married yesterday to Douglas Hugh Mackay Pyle, the son of Elizabeth Pyle Whitney of Weston, Mass., and the late Dr. Hugh Mackay Pyle. The Rev. Dr. Theodore Rosche, a Presbyterian minister, performed the ceremony at the Strong Mansion, a historic house in Dickerson, Md.

The couple graduated from Carleton College, the bride magna cum laude. They work in Chicago, where the bride is a fellow in pediatric infectious diseases at Children's Memorial Hospital and the bridegroom is the assistant to the president of the Chicago Transit Authority.

Dr. Freeman, 29, is keeping her name. She received her medical degree magna cum laude from Georgetown University. Her father, who retired as an executive vice president for external affairs at the American Express Company in New York, is the founder and chairman of the Mark Twain Institute, an organization in Chevy Chase that gives grants for economic research. Her mother, who retired as the head librarian at the public library in Poolesville, Md., is a docent at the Corcoran Gallery of Art in Washington.

Mr. Pyle, 30, received an M.B.A. from Yale. His mother retired as the associate director of financial aid at Brandeis University in Waltham, Mass. His father was a hematologist and oncologist at New England Deaconess Hospital in Boston and a clinical instructor in medicine at Harvard University. The bridegroom is a stepson of Charles A. Whitney, an emeritus professor of astronomy at Harvard and former senior scientist at the Smithsonian Astrophysical Observatory.
